query: Does the application/framework use content delivery networks (CDNs) to minimize recomputation or fetching of static data?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.
Use Service Mesh probe if you prefer Service Mesh stack and don’t want to use native agents.
Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in pure tracing status. (Advanced usage)
Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:
Judgement: Not Applicable
Explanation: The context provided does not mention anything about using CDNs for optimizing the loading of static data in any way. It discusses profiling, event logging and linkages with other distributed tracing systems but nothing pertaining to minimizing recomputation or fetching through a network approach like CDN usage is mentioned within these details.

query: Does the application/framework employ gzip compression to reduce storage requirements and bandwidth?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.
Use Service Mesh probe if you prefer Service Mesh stack and don’t want to use native agents.
Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in pure tracing status. (Advanced usage)
Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:
Judgement: Not Applicable
Explanation: The context provided does not mention anything about using gzip compression for data reduction or network efficiency in any of the profiling, monitoring tools discussed (SkyWalking, Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus). query: Does the application/framework use tools to identify and clean up unused code and libraries?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.
Use Service Mesh probe if you prefer Service Mesh stack and don’t want to use native agents.
Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in pure tracing status. (Advanced usage)
Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.
response_text:
Judgement: Not Applicable
Explanation: The context does not mention anything about identifying or removing unused code or libraries, instead it discusses profiling with SkyWalking and various agents. Profiling is used for understanding performance rather than code cleanup. Furthermore, there's no discussion on tools specific to identify the dead (unused) codes in this context.

query: Does the application/framework employ traffic shaping techniques to manage lower priority traffic during peak times?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:

What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Besides the support of various kinds of telemetry formats, the hierarchy structure of objects in SkyWalking is defined as service(s), service instance(s), endpoint(s), process(s). The terms Service, Instance and Endpoint are used everywhere today, so it is worth defining their specific meanings in the context of SkyWalking:

query: Does the application/framework migrate AI/ML workloads to cloud regions with a commitment to sustainability?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.
Use Service Mesh probe if you prefer Service Mesh stack and don’t want to use native agents.
Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in pure tracing status. (Advanced usage)
Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:
Judgement: Not Applicable
Explanation: The context provided discusses profiling tools, eBPF agents, and Service Mesh probes for software development applications. It does not mention anything about migrating AI/ML workloads to cloud regions or any commitment to sustainability in the process. Therefore, this application is not applicable with respect to the question asked.

query: Does the application/framework take advantage of pre-trained models to quickly prototype and deploy AI solutions?
context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.
Use 3rd-party instrument library only, like the Zipkin instrument ecosystem.
Use Service Mesh probe if you prefer Service Mesh stack and don’t want to use native agents.
Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in pure tracing status. (Advanced usage)
Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:
Response: <No>
Explanation: The context provided does not mention anything about using or taking advantage of pre-trained models, artificial intelligence, or prototyping with such technologies. It is focused on tracing, profiling, event recording, portability across various infrastructures and environments, as well as integration capabilities with other systems for monitoring purposes.

context_text:
Use Language based native agent only to build topology and metrics for your business application.

Use eBPF agent only if you only want to profile on demand and/or activating automatic performance analysis.
Use eBPF agent with Language based native agent collaboratively. Enhance the traces with the eBPF agent to collect extra information.
What is the meaning of in tracing status?

---

Profiling. Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?

---

Zabbix, Zipkin, Prometheus, SkyWalking can integrate with other distributed tracing, metrics and logging systems and build a unified APM system to host all data.

---

Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.

---

Only works in certain frameworks or libraries. Since the agents are responsible for modifying the codes during runtime, the codes are already known to the agent plugin developers. There is usually a list of frameworks or libraries supported by this kind of probes. For example, see the SkyWalking Java agent supported list.
response_text:
Judgement: Not Applicable

Profiling is a powerful tool to help developers understand the performance of their applications from lines of codes perspective. SkyWalking provides profiling feature bundled in native language agents and independent ebpf agents.
Event. Event is a special kind of data, which is used to record the important moments in the system, such as version upgrade, configuration change, etc. Linking the events with metrics could help on explain the peaks or valleys in the metrics, and linking the events with traces and logs could help on troubleshooting root cause.
Why use SkyWalking?', metadata={'id': 'documentsFromText/SkyWalking/content.txt:None:2', 'source': 'documentsFromText/SkyWalking/content.txt'}), 1518.3682924635252), (Document(page_content='Portability. SkyWalking can run in multiple environments, including: (1) Use traditional register center like eureka. (2) Use RPC framework including service discovery, like Spring Cloud, Apache Dubbo. (3) Use Service Mesh in modern infrastructure. (4) Use cloud services. (5) Across cloud deployment. SkyWalking should run well in all of these cases.', metadata={'id': 'documentsFromText/SkyWalking/content.txt:None:13', 'source': 'documentsFromText/SkyWalking/content.txt'}), 1599.6264722647516), (Document(page_content='Only works in certain frameworks or libraries.
